item.title: ‘Peak Goldilocks’: The markets have bought the Fed rumors — watch for them to sell on the news
item.description: Markets will move on Wednesday after Wall Street parses Cook’s statement and his Q&A for clues about future rate cuts beyond Wednesday.

item.title: Trump is pushing for a ‘big cut’ from the Fed—but he’s already on a losing streak
item.description: Trump failed to oust Fed Governor Lisa Cook and is unlikely to get the steep rate cut he demands, as Powell and the FOMC weigh weaker jobs data.

item.title: The first person to get a Neuralink chip in his brain says he met Elon Musk on the day of his surgery: ‘He’s a cool dude’
item.description: The 31-year-old Neuralink brain-computer interface recipient says he and Musk later discussed SpaceX and had an "alien talk."

item.title: What CEOs think about the SEC ‘prioritizing’ Trump’s plan to end quarterly reporting for public companies
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Scientists confirm what employees already know: Working from home really does make you happier
item.description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella may think that remote work weakens social ties and makes workers less innovative, but the research is in and one thing is ...
